NM2taf3kV8tRTPO6J5KmTQ.text: Surprisingly good sushi for an airport bar. Moreso than the food, I was impressed with the bartender Antoine. He was extremely personable for someone who is only talking to people in between their flights. Overall great food and great service. I'll be back next time I fly through Charlotte.

TC_rEX9QIXoodtwiyipnCg.text: I've been here several times in the last few years, and it is hit or miss.  This time was not good.  The portion was very good for the price, location and people watching is great, and servers were very friendly.  But the sushi was grocery store quality or worse.  The shrimp tempura is not fried on site and is prepackaged in a huge bag, pulled from the refrigerator, piled onto a plate about four deep, then microwaved and set onto the kitchen prep area.  When it is served inside a roll, all you can taste is soggy breading. The spicy crab topping was even worse and had the consistency of finely chopped up bread wth orange food coloring.  I'll pass next time.

nhh1iIS5I1WHpWilgey4Gg.text: Decent sushi and pretty quick service. It's not the best sushi you will ever have and not the worst. I gave 4 stars based on speed and service. It's a nice alternative to burgers and pizza.

XSEuvBEsfhuqdxAMjrVVRA.text: Dear future Daniel.   Remember.   Airport Sushi is not your friend.   You will forget this later, but then you will recall and remorse.    Fish were not ever meant to fly.

MdvT-DoOw8CiySWhAIoitQ.text: I was surprised airport sushi could be this good! Got it to order and they were quick. Not more overpriced than most restaurants or grocery stores

_t8oGAbDffj-4J-lGJixWg.text: This bar is located in the Airport in Charlotte. It was better than expected but far from being the best I have had. The man preparing the sushi did an excellent job with the preparation of the food. The fish he was working with had the appearance of being frozen and thawed. This was not his fault. He was working with what he had and his presentation was very good. Oh! I got the poke seasoned and on a bed of sea weed. I enjoyed the poke which would of been much better if the fish was firmer. There was no fishy taste or smell just not as firm as I would of liked. Will I go back? If in the airport on another visit to Charlotte I would probably try them again.

W92-RT84hTQ3IVcsE12Dsw.text: The Outer Banks Roll was awesome. Had sushi is Japan a few years ago and this was pretty comparable. Service was okay but the sushi was solid.

9EF7f6lZVQQ_3uuGkwaWaA.text: Pricy and so so. The service was quick but the sushi was cold which turned me off.i only tried the rolls.  The rolls are pretty big so one per person should be enough.

gS0hpWjVqXNR9w88nZkzrQ.text: Came to sit at bar was told they open at 3. Sat there for 20 minutes only to be rudely told by a short stocky blond server with tattoos on her right arm that they open at 4. I let her know we were told 3. She says well that woulda been 20 minutes ago as though our presence annoyed her.  I get it's an airport but she is a terrible front facing representative of the franchise. In addition she stood there on her cell phone in view of all guests.  Horrible attitude.

4Dp7IZHxnBQSY7y9xv8prw.text: $11 for a spicy tuna roll to go. They give you 12 decently large pieces which is nice. It was decent for airport food, I would grab and go from here again. Also took me less than a minute to check out. FYI the register is located a few feet from the actual sushi bar so don't try to buy it from the people behind the bar like I did

pT8BAoB28xysKMKlL7FpvA.text: Picked up a tuna roll here before my flight. Generous portion at an airport price, but still a good value. More tuna than rice, so that's good.

Pge5W7Zhdn9LlRz0xNbqJQ.text: Charlotte's airport has a carnival like feel to it and I suppose because of that I was feeling campy and adventurous. Therefore I decided to go for airport sushi.   I've never had a good experience before with airport sushi and you gotta imagine on a scale of Jiro Dreams of Sushi down to convenience-store-in-the-middle-of-nowhere sushi, Hissho Sushi ranks like the white fish in a chirashi bowl. You don't really need it but you'll eat it.   Really this deserves a 3.5 rating as it's located in a modern area of the airport that is borderline chic. You'd imagine sushi would be sold here is what I'm saying.   Our rolls really weren't bad at all. Actually it was surprisingly good if you're considering where you are in the U.S. The rolls themselves were not even absurdly priced. Ours were about 10-14 dollars. The fish quality was decent too.   So I'd put Hissho and Bojangles as two places to eat in Charlotte's airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

t6a-hAmfWDLnJIPwklbnGA.text: Bought their sushi-to-go out of their case, sat down at one of their tables, waitress promptly told me that Sushi to go customers cannot sit at their tables, have to sit at the food court :(  FYI the sushi was pretty good :)

CAIxmV00lZKMkUv-u-GCgQ.text: I try to stop here everytime I fly through. They have great sushi...you would never think you were eating at an airport!

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gran Finale

GQbqHv7dv6BuWjdVZ-TsWg.text: Located in the beautiful central atrium with the iconic white rockers, this place offers excellent service with the best people-watching. Great if you are flying out of terminal C or B at Charlotte NC airport.  I had the grand finale roll with Tempura shrimp, avocado, and cucumber. It is topped with spicy crab that almost looks like grated cheddar cheese, scallions and red & black tobiko. I love those crunchy fish eggs, but it was kind of hard to eat them with chopsticks. Flavor was decent, nothing I wii crave but it was healthier than most  airport options and was a positive experience overall. Spicy crab had a kick but was a minor player in overall taste.  Hot green tea tasted good, but mine was served in a paper cup. Service quick, efficient and pleasant all the way through.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Some of the rolls. My lunch was about $22 with tip.
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunny day makes fir a cheerful atmosphere

i_pzWA7psMqYbIEjFl7kVA.text: I often have to go through this airport when I travel because there are barely any direct flights from where I live. If you need to get something quickly and run this place is ok.

9l7CbsSrpP4VvO03jtI25A.text: Arrived at 3:20 and all the tables had a chair on top to close them and every barstool at restaurant kiosk. Was told by blonde lady with tattoos that they weren't open except to eat in airport. Very rude. Obviously didn't eat there.

vDghPaFAJOGEAzRa9ZxaLg.text: I had a couple hour lay over here and needed a place to eat and relax waiting on my flight. At 1pm on a Saturday it was not busy at all. Rolls were hand made and came out fast. The drinks were good and not watered down. The bartender was great and very attentive. I waited just a couple minutes before he asked to help.   The taste of the Orville & Wilbur's Roll was good. For being in an airport, the quality was decent. Not a top rated sushi restaurant but definitely good for air port quality. The sweet chili sauce on this roll was not overly heavy and let the tuna flavor come through. The spicy crab inside was excellent.   For seating, there were tons of high top tables or bar options. Because food cane or quite quick, you would not have to wait long even if they were full.   Overall, I highly recommend this stop if your on a layover and have a need for some sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

YrFVFbHWkjDD2HgTb_sWGw.text: I wish I could zero stars. I walked up to the counter and asked "is this where I order takeout". This nasty nasty blonde lady (didn't catch her name), says "well you're going to need to find a seat at the bar top I have other things to get to". So I patiently wait for a seat to open up, one finally does, but I can't sit because she would not clean off the last persons spot. As I'm standing there waiting, she is making rude comments like "some people need to learn patience" and I said "well if I was sitting I would be able to wait but I'm trying to go catch my flight". She walks away with a huge huff. After 20 minutes of avoiding me or making eye contact, she comes over FINALLY clears the place for me to sit, the goes I'll be with you in a minute. I politely said Ok great. She then does not come back for another 10 minutes saying sorry it's busy she's trying her best. Now it's about 30 minutes of waiting to place an order after being spoken to rudely at every interaction. Another lady came up during this time and asked about order and the blonde lady again got loud with her telling her to find a seat and she'll get to her when she gets to her. Finally, the sushi chef asked if she took my order and I said no she has been ignoring me every time I try to order. She then raises her voice at me and says "well you're not sitting Are you eating here or not" I said "no, I specifically asked where to go to order take out and you told me the bar ma'am. I have been here over a half hour now and all you've done is huff and made snide comments" she looked around for someone to defend her and said "we'll we don't do that here" but the other 6 tables looked and agreed she was being rude. Needless to say, I wish I got her name so I can contact her manager and complain there as well because she has made me waste a good chunk of time versus telling me from the start "we don't do take out". Additionally, the plates are disposable plastic, I could have easily taken the plate with me as she was throwing them out after people left anyway. She didn't apologize or show any remorse for the inconvenience. This was a horrible horrible experience.

88D2gfHVCankSKiu-h4KmA.text: It's alright, I was in such a craving for sushi cause everything in North Carolina is fried. Servers were very friendly but the food wasn't the greatest. The wine came in some fancy glasses though which was cool. But I would recommend this place if you are trying to get away from the fried food.

KxFJrvLIcCgyKKk1k0GTRw.text: The server/bartender was very rude.  She scolded guests for having bags on the chairs and was very pushy with ordering.

_yQ11OPK9VvGVpTgozsxUA.text: Avoid...  The lack of service is just the start.  You failed to have a clean dining facility.  The tables were all full of trash and had sticky substances on them all except the four tables that were populated.  You (the server) failed to address it nor even recognize the problem. I know you have to focus on your hair but us travelers are here to eat and get in and out to cat h our flights.

jmdnpM6ot2fIqWcLpRErnA.text: There are just some places in the United States I feel I MUST stop.  Every time I pass through Charlotte this sushi bar is worth the stop.

PZiQPo3PxgMq_FmfCSC0Pg.text: Delicious and unusual rolls. Seaweed salad is yummy and the portion is huge. Had the Crown Town and Southern Charm rolls. They were delicious

bqDM029ROyMFEFQyLn87Xg.text: If you're looking for a quick bite before your next flight this is a decent spot to grab a sushi roll. I didn't want to eat another burger and fries and needed something light.  The service is super fast. I sat at the bar, the bartender quickly grabbed my drink and kept an eye on me until I was ready to order. I got the Ocean's Delight roll with tuna, yellow tail, salmon, avocado, cucumber, and lettuce. It came out in less than 10min! Some of the fastest sushi I've ever had, but in fact that does have an impact on the end product. It was decent. The rolls were thinly sliced and the rice was bland. It needed soy sauce to give it a boost. Of course, being airport sushi it was expensive for an ok final product - $13 for the roll (8 pieces). But if you're going to get airport sushi, this spot is worth a stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ocean&#39;s Delight - tuna, salmon, yellow tail, avocado, lettuce, cucumber

i75L__Y_Ej2W5DFk-0FGtg.text: Not bad for quick bite, I order eel roll because I looked at fish I don't like way looks so order some cook fish for safe side.  my flight is late afternoon good place to have few drink and bite for sure. But I like my sushi better

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

NDbaX2kp2DZwx67or3c3vA.text: I am so disappointed in this restaurant. I just encountered a woman named Jocelyn. Her response to be ordering from a table 4 feet away from her bar area was a big fat no. After being delayed many times I needed a table with a plug to charge my phone. I asked to order to go and I will sit within arms reach of the bar. Her response, "It is what it is."  Needless to say my friend and I left. Life is too short to deal with rude staff. I am a former server myself and have never spoken to someone like that. Just down the terminal in D there Carolina Beer Company. Immediately greeted with smiles.

MoQdFEQtorJoMoI43jfGkA.text: It is an island in the main area of the Charlotte airport.   I stopped here to wait for my boss to get in. So I ordered a double rye and ginger... holly cow!! Pretty sure they poured the rye and then just waved the can over the cup and called it good!  HSOF (Holly S**t on fire) this drink was stout!  It is an interesting place... sushi bar basically... with all kinds of flying machines spinning slowly over head.  Nice people... strong drink!

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Knob creek rye and ginger
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

tFycKW24YK_8xA3_mYUQVg.text: Convenient sushi but not great.   Was in a sushi mood so this fit the bill but was not impressed. The server was pleasant enough but didn't ask how much time I had.   The rolls were beautiful but didn't taste as good as they looked. The rice were over-vinegared and slushy and the crab in one of the rolls was tasteless with an odd texture. Surprisingly bad for the amount of volume this location must get.   Will likely try some of the other places nearby before venturing here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

DeLkDLi97zXHdk4gqf8Qyw.text: I agree with the other three star reviews. It's the best sushi place in CLT but that's because it's the only one. Seems to be a healthier option than barbeque or Chick-fil-A and the portions are good. But don't expect a decent sushi experience.   Rice is soggy and fish is old. But you're eating it in North Carolina, so Bon Appetite!

fK8x0lLSzcqi1bphqqbdZw.text: Another first! Stop to grab some sushi (at the airport) not bad, glad I did. The service was great and the food was very good.  Kisha was awesome! Took great care of me. Made me feel at home. Thanks sweetheart!

LbPqbUj-rKZj6Nfqb2Vi0w.text: 3.5/5 (considering this is from an airport in SC...) I just got back from a trip where I basically haven't had sushi for over 2 weeks and as a sushi addict I needed a fix as soon as I saw a place.  I walked past this place over and over I'm sure if I really should give it a shot but there's not very many other fresh/lighter options in the airport so I went for it and honestly I'm not mad.  There is bar seating and a few tables or you can pick up food from the takeout display. Though the stuff in the display definitely looked like it's been sitting out there for a bit and I wouldn't go for it. I ended up sitting at one of the tables and the waitress helped me out right away. Service was very friendly and prompt the entire time. Menu prices are definitely a little ridiculous for both the sushi and any of the side items. I'm not sure if it's because it's in South Carolina or because it's airport food but I would say everything is approximately $3 more than you would be paying anywhere else.  As far as the quality of the sushi goes the price is actually semi decent. Fairly sticky texture without being too mushy or too hard and the vinegary sweetness is actually quite noticeable. Not my ideal ratios but better than underseasoned rice. The fish quality is not the best but also could be worse. I didn't get sick from it and there was a decent firmness with some flavor for the hamachi.  I ordered the crown temple roll and an order of the hamachi nigiri. The rolls are very sizable and the majority of them contain tempura sushi which I'm not a huge fan of in rolls. The crown temple roll was basically just 3 shades of mild spiciness (Sriracha, wasabi, jalapeno) with some tuna and it wasn't too interesting but not bad either. The hamachi nigiri was also pretty good. The cut of fish was sizable but not too thick and the rice was well flavored. The ratio of rice to fish was a little much but that's an easy fix. The hamachi was actually quite fatty and flavorful which I was surprised by.  Overall I left very full and pretty content. For airport sushi I'm pretty impressed. Assuming the prices are just cuz of the airport location, then it's not a bad spot.

KwfNUKCHmzpiN-2_U44RIw.text: I have passed by this restaurant in the Charlotte airport for years and never tried it. Because I have eaten at every other restaurant I decided to try something different. I sat myself and the server was at my table almost immediately. I asked for vegan options and she pointed to one sushi roll that would fit the bill. I also ordered Edamame and a glass of wine.   The wine came out in a very cute square PLASTIC wine glass. I almost spilled it on myself trying to drink out of it, but quickly got the hang of it. My edamame arrived in a plastic dish with a plastic cup to discard the shells. I finished those and my sushi rolls were delivered on a plastic plate. See the theme here--plastic.    The rolls were delicious and the service good. I've added this to my list of restaurants to go back to in CLT since there are very few with good ratings anymore.

5Oh9gZAEP7AmJinv85_61g.text: Great sushi rolls right in the middle of the atrium between all gates. Very nice staff - super fresh food! With live piano entertainment next to you - doesn't get much better than that on a layover!

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Orville &amp;Wilburs Roll - Sweet &amp; Chili sauce tuna

-j9QVyi0xiYuQrg58m058Q.text: Bottom line - it was not fresh and not good, but with great service. I think this place used to be in the main area, but it's now smaller and in terminal D. I tried the Grand Finale roll and a California roll. The tempura shrimp in the first roll was not fresh. It was like it was done a while ago and saved. Not good. None of the other ingredients in either roll tasted fresh. The bright spot was the friendly and professional server. She was great - on top of everything, accommodating, and super friendly. Not enough, though to make up for the food. I don't think I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grand Finale roll and California roll

7LDL1eqtvhZ_B2S8ciwSig.text: The place is in the center of the Airport atrium. They have bar stools like a sushi bar and the have tables. Insat down in a corner where inoticedbtywrebwas an electrical outlet so I can recharge. As i sat down, I was greeted warmly by Gemma who has such a nice personality.  I only had about an hour to munch on something. They have a sake on tap. The Bushido, way of the warrior sake. It is filtered and suitable for what I was looking for. They do not have a nigori(unfiltered sake) which was no problem. I choose the salad with ginger dressing. It was a little bit different from the plain orange ginger dressing. It was more like ginger and soy sauce combo. It worked.  I also ordered the sunset roll which contained spicy crab, avocado, cucumber with large pieces of tuna and salmon sashimi. It was perfect. It may have enough for 2 people but I managed to not leave anything. The warmth and friendliness of Gemma is what makes this place. She engages quite nicely with her customers and they react to her kindly. They also have quite a few wines and craft beers on tap. Its a good place to come during a layover or if you arrive early before your flight.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunset roll
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salad with chunks of avocado and ginger soy sauce
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bushido way of the warrior

jASkuEOO7CjB3oQKOPNUUg.text: Centrally located in the atrium with sit-down or grab and go options. If you have time between flights and decide to sit, you'll need to order a drink or food here. If you prefer to grab the takeaway sushi, there's plenty of seating in the immediate food court area, upstairs lounge area or there's also the rocking chairs at the edge of the atrium.   I agree with the other reviews that it's a bit overpriced but at least the rolls are decently sized & filling. I've been here at least half a dozen times or more and never had a bad experience. It's always tasted fine especially if you opt for the specialty rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. [ International Roll ] shrimp tempura topped with eel &amp; salmon, spicy mayo &amp; eel sauce

4EFX-MOsdPUlCxyxN9bB8g.text: I'm definitely giving a little leeway for the fact that this place is in an airport so the bar is set low but honestly I've always been happy with my meal here. I fly through CLT more than any other airport and very often the last thing I want before a long flight is something heavy and greasy that might upset my stomach. No way am I eating a fast food burger and getting on a plane for six hours.  The sushi bar is centrally located in the atrium in the middle of the airport with most of the other food. I usually grab a seat at the bar, listen to whoever is playing the piano and enjoy a sushi roll with some miso soup for lunch. It's just the right amount of food and they hand make the rolls to order. I've never done the grab and go because they're usually pretty quick when made fresh to order.

MyBflD8Szdr6JRIgMwxvQg.text: Been coming here for years, and used to be better but it's still good. The CLT roll was my go to but it's gone downhill in the last few years. No more jalapenos on it. On this visit I ordered the layover, which is one pice each of salmon, tuna and yellowtail. Fish was good, tasted fresh. Rice was a massive ball so I split it in half and it was perfect. I had the outer banks roll as well and it was really good with a spicy sauce on the side. Service was good and the food was good as well.

aJV5lFxm6_jYC-I3TTWqeQ.text: Given typical airport prices, this sushi stop was a quick and easy way to get some fresh sushi. There is a veggie roll with cucumber, avocado, carrots, and asparagus for vegetarians and vegans! The woman working the To Go Booth was very kind and efficient. It is right next to the Charlotte Airport's grand piano and rocking chairs. Definitely worth a stop!

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. To Go or Sit Down options
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

1Eu_vTJntWGxwebHcJNteg.text: This place is terrible. No could figure out how to check me out for a to go order (and there is no signage). My spicy tuna roll was totally inedible as it was FROZEN. Would have taken it back had I not been on the complete other end of the airport when I opened it up to eat. I know not to expect *too* much from an airport sushi bar, but I wouldn't have expect it to be THIS bad. Avoid.

Okya-IXsjTKF6FaNL3GhXQ.text: You know what, this was really really good. The plastic dinner and glassware is a bit discordant, but the sushicado roll and the ginger salad were exceptionally flavorful and hit the spot. And there is live piano right behind you. And the service is jumping. All good.

J6uKKRwCSg1WCErth9Z9wA.text: Very beautiful display at the top of the bar. I had the salmon pokini, it was great though some of the pieces of salmon were a bit fibrous. Lovely location and nice live piano music.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

2Mlxihpk2NXlSS28ruq44g.text: Considering this is airport, high volume sushi, amazingly good!  Normally I'd expect overpriced but not so here. Fairly fair price with very good fresh quality.  Whenever I travel through Charlotte,  I look forward to stopping here.  Service is a touch slow because they're busy.  The staff really hustles but there's a lot of people coming through. One nice touch- there is usually someone playing piano background music in the area which is very relaxing.

hGLsTNtvlA6ROd8iqBnvLg.text: Charlotte's got a lot. A lot of choices for food if you're spending time on a layover at this major East Coast hub for American Airlines. Hissho Sushi is an ideal option as it is centrally located in the main atrium and they have a decent selection of premade sushi for eating here or taking to go.  The variety is good and the prices are reasonable. $14 for a higher end roll and as low as $8 or so for something not quite as fancy. I got a rainbow roll today and it was good. Not as good as some, but better than should be expected for airport fresh fish considering that some things are prepared off site and they're also restricted on knives here thanks to the TSA.  Worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rainbow roll from Hissho Sushi

EoUda1rO1ZJPBW-1KbF3wQ.text: It's all about the expectations. Seriously.  I mean, look around at your other choices at CTL - you're looking at a slate of stuff like Qizno's, Sbarro's, McDonald's, etc. in short, a veritable plethora of plebian-ness. In *that* company, this may very well be the very best that you can hope for.   Anyhow, on to the sushi. It's about as generic as you can get - tuna, salmon, yellowtail, and various combinations thereof formed into rolls. Speaking of which, get the rolls, they're, at the least, acceptable, and the various stuff they put on top of them at least gives them some form of flavor...  The beer is cold (there is Kirin), so, well, theres that (though, for whatever reason, they're all served in cheesy plastic cups)  Oh, btw, stay away from the eel (unagi) - it's pretty foul...

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

6Q6LKSWJ8UJL-akp80y_5Q.text: I waited there for more then 30 minutes and continued to not be acknowledged from the bar staff. No one came uo, gave me a meanie. I just left after that. This shows me that they do not want my business and don't really care enough to even approach their customers. I would highly recommend skipping this place especially if you are in a hurry and trying to find a fast meal. So naturally I substituted string cheese for sushi.

HVyxN-G8NOfUHo2cEnilVw.text: This is for the Hissho Sushi stand in the D terminal.  Sushi was average grocery store quality sushi.  Not good but didn't get me sick.  The problem was I came here on a very slow afternoon during a layover.  Only two people eating here and plenty of workers standing around.  As I approached the register over at the Ciao gourmet place next door. There was nobody at all working the Hissho stand when I took my sushi from the self service cooler in the front, although halfway thru eating, Hissho workers appeared.  I noticed the cashier at Ciao and two other workers were chatting.  I stood behind worker number 2 as she blocked me from approaching the register.  They were talking about some other coworker apparently, glanced at me standing there with my sushi, drink, and bags, rolled her eyes and turned around to finish her conversation.  Not moving an inch, acknowledging, or greeting me.  After a long 20 seconds she decides her conversation was done and decided to allow me to approach and put my stuff down.  The register girl went from laughing with her friends to scowling at me.  F these lazy POS workers.  Better yet fire them.

EUkUjRyG9HwtcEnovJZong.text: I have stopped here for dinner at least twenty times in the past 18 months...  I usually get the 9-piece sashimi.  While they don't have the variety of fish types a good city place would have, it has always been fresh and very good.  One of my favorite airport options!   The service is great too - you'll find many road warrior regulars like me!

qwWZGJsllG86ba2SSKYTeg.text: NOT GOOD, Just ate there before boarding flight back to NY.  Feel very sick right now.  Sushi came from pre-packaged box.  "Why would you get sushi from an airport in Charlotte" is what i am asking myself throughout this very painfull flight

ohcUSopAOUzM5TXlPP6Hvw.text: Southern Charm special roll is none too shabby.

wRj64k5CUCsPAsutAuh6KQ.text: I was very surprised how fresh the Sushi rolls where for being in a airport restaurant. I couldn't give them a five star ratting because of the lack of knowledge the the waitress had at the table service. I suggest grabbing something from the case and then sitting down to eat it.

NXgyiD7kVlS2tcHg1L8FxA.text: Airport Sushi probably doesn't sound like a wise choice, but it was actually pretty good.  Grabbed a quick lunch before flight took off.  Had the Tuna on seaweed salad and pork gyoza for heartiness.  The Tuna was good, they give you a decent portion in a martini glass with seaweek salad on the bottom.  The tuna wasn't swimming in spicy mayo which was great, it had a light dressing on it and just your typical seaweek salad.  Very flavorful and not as heavy as having a sushi roll, so at least when you get on your flight you're not weighed down.  The gyoza was just a standard gyoza but I ordered it in case the tuna wasn't enough to keep me full, so at least this way I had a bit of meat for heartiness.

HExICDJdC6UcJgdonsupwg.text: Waited ten minutes for any of the six people working that day to even make eye contact with me as I sat at the bar. Nobody did. So f*ck 'em, I took my money somewhere else.

mFTl_gWBmk6sDTqfdfnu9Q.text: When in Charlotte, enjoy some sushi instead of the typical overpriced fast food normally found in airports.  It is pricey, but no worse than any other sushi bar.  I recommend the Tuna Poke.  Served in a Martini glass and SO delicious.  Perfect place to spend a layover.

iFu8qX3cPxVF1sYv8ziX8w.text: I was introduced to First Flight by my friend who is based in CLT with Nascar. He had to take me there because he raved over the sushi and the sake. When I was flying out of there not in my uniform I gave it a shot. It's strategically placed in CLT where the main food court is after security. Make no mistake, it looks like a bar. BUT you can get sushi and sashimi to go on the fly at the walk up area and pay at the bar. I just wasn't that impressed. I tried to keep in mind that it is sushi.. in a airport.. and IN Charlotte. Because I grew up near the sea where the sushi is still squealing , or whatever sushi would do if they could yell, I am, without a doubt pretty picky about my sushi. Sake is sake. It's strong..hot.. and can jack you up before flying if your not cautious. Well, I felt that way about the sushi. I don't care how sweet Carolina the staff is, and they all are! I truly hoped I made it through this 5 hour flight home with no sushi remorse.

gF8VMPCDaDksi_b-Bm5zvA.text: 1.5 stars.  I was excited as I rolled off my flight in the D concourse but the service only seemed to be for the carryout option at 9:30 (disappointing) and the take out was pretty crappy.  I've had average sushi before and this joint, while nestled in a hip and fashionable looking section of the concourse, had pretty below-average sushi.  Avoid, especially considering the price.

fOo5r05WZXza09rwbpl1Lw.text: Went past this place a few times in my travels and always was hesitant because what are the chances that you wouldn't die eating sushi from an airport in good'ol Charlotte.  One would think high.  Anyway, seeing that this place was always busy and being in a gambling mood I figured I'd check it out.  Tried the triple mango roll and was pleasantly surprised.  Everything was fresh and tasty.  Certainly not the best sushi I've ever eaten but better and cheaper than some "finer" establishments I've eaten at in my coastal home town.  Food is pretty fresh since they crank out the rolls and the atmosphere is nice with an occasional piano playing in the background. Been back a few times since then, and it hasn't disappointed yet so I would recommend it.

Kqmd0V-KH-ZPACWmJhViRQ.text: Big pieces of sashimi, but not very much flavor.  Kirin ichiban is on tap, but its $7 per beer!  not great but it is nice to have a sushi bar in the airport.

3NwcKdKk3UecKu2p01FpGg.text: I know what you're thinkin ..sushi in an airport- that's dangerous! Well they had a 101 health code ranking so why not ! Well it left a lot to be desired .  Slimy fish ...messy rolls ...gross sweet chili sauce covering every inch . Maybe I just picked the wrong roll but I wouldn't eat here again.

QN0THzO10Hiu4_mG6WlOiA.text: Pleasantly surprised! I have layovers in Charlotte almost every week but was too hesitant to try until yesterday (I knew I was about to face another week of trying to live off of omelets and Burger King salads in Tallahassee because I refuse to eat fried chicken and grits... yes that is all they serve here). Menu is nothing spectacular, but has all the basics. I ordered 2 salmon rolls and edamame. Salmon was fresh and the rice was perfect. Edamame was... edamame. Servers were extremely nice and helpful (although that could just be because I'm in no way accustomed to southern hospitality). Expect to pay $1-2 more per roll than you would if you were A) not in an airport, and B) not in Charlotte, NC.

EuY6hbg0XQQU3FkVRMB0wA.text: First it at airport but no excuses here. Wonderful sushi and best choice at airport. Little on expensive side especially drinks but food is high quality. Recommend the clt role if you like your rolls a bit spicy. Try it whe in clt between terminal b and c you won't be disappointed.

-6pYauvqU6BJaVmaDVeHiQ.text: Decent Sushi in the airport.  You can watch them make all the sushi, and they can sure pump it out quick for how busy they can get.  Pretty expensive being in an airport, but that's the premium that you pay when traveling.

OzqS4w_SRpe6yp_ltpCWfQ.text: It's overpriced airport food, the sushi is ok at best. But compared to other places it's healthier.

2y_5vQEn0U0bhIW6J62F6w.text: Pretty awesome I grabbed a sushi rolls between flights . It was Johnny on the spot between terminals. They had the to go pack (finger food) in the main food court. Just what I needed when I was in a hurry. I didn't have to wander into the heart of the food court. Just grab, pay and go. Further more it was delicious.

eHNBobNok8Tj4kVXEWQdBw.text: The 9 piece sashimi was amazing.  Wanted good sashimi the entire vacation, finally found it on my layover on my trip home.

uyXbblvE4fsq4ERNP9gkkg.text: I have flown through here a couple of times and debates if I wanted to get Sushi here. After reading several reviews I finally caved in. I ended up getting prepackaged rolls, salmon avocado and tuna rolls so I can't judge the freshly made stuff. At best they were just below average and rather flavorless. The wasabi was weak and fake (horseradish, mustard and peppers.) And the prepackaged stuff also has very little ginger but they will give you more of you just ask. Prices were reasonable for the amount you get especially at an airport. About $8 for each tray which had 16 small pieces. In the end. The it wasn't terrible but will try something else when I'm here again.

43bq9h_R8xPLAeqsfmtA3Q.text: This is sitting in the middle of Charlotte's Airport and it is the gem in this Queen City's crown. I was so happy to wait for my next flight with such a nice sushi option.  I really dug the ambience here with the piano being played right next to the venue.  The options were amazing but the service was STELLAR from a server named Jamie.  She did not miss a beat and I witnessed various customers openly letting her know how happy they were with her.  I also noticed that there was even one customer offering his business card to come work for his business!  I am giving this score mostly because the service was so good but also because the sushi itself was good. Go get you some!

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The grande finale is light and irresistible
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Miso good!
Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh fast friendly

-xJeY-EMK470sAv5jBkegQ.text: The Grand Finale was not great- cold old shrimp tempura not crispy with too much fishy roe. The Joel Gott wind was well worth the $14 a plastic glass. The waitress Rachelle was great ran the busy place while some young male never pitched in and pretended to do BS busy work ... Including checking & browsing his cell phone every. 5 minutes. Because if that my roll sat quite awhile till she was free to serve it. One roll one wine one tip $36 yikes

ySplXn6b3st_2R9Uae-uQA.text: Really good sushi. Different choices than your average sushi place. $7.99 for a 20oz beer, but it's an airport. Love stopping at CLT just for First in Flight. Southern Charm Roll taste American, but is really good

MAtNIrsOUxUkGa4BjljJwA.text: Coming from California, this is ok to good. I'm talking about the rolls. I'd have to rate the sashimi 2.5-3 stars. The rolls fill you up for what they are. The sashimi was, I think too thick of slices to really enjoy it. But unfortunately salmon and yellowtail is more prone to "fishy" tasting. It's hard to get those fish fresh if you're not by a fish market. The tuna was good, but I've had better. Otherwise if you have time to waste, I'd come here.

V57mpCQitfyPkcIVo3OTjg.text: Read about this place in the US Airways magazine and since I had enough time between flights I figured I'd give it a go.  Wow....dang good sushi!  I ordered the CLT Roll. Spicy salmon, jalapeno, cucumber and white fish on top with some spicy sauce drizzled over the roll. It was delicious!  Quite spicy but in my opinion is was perfect.   While it was a little pricey eating here, it was well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. CLT Roll

yzSiQpZBnJ2jviB-SBrhEg.text: Great sushi. Considering it's in the airport the price is reasonable. I have had the salmon lovers roll twice now and both visits the staff were helpful and pleasant. Thank you for a great lunch

sgMAUbENFP4IqQRavy7ykQ.text: The black dragon roll is great. Seems like a popular watering hole for ppl on layovers.  Staff is ok. Took me a while to get my water and I was already super dehydrated from traveling. On top of that, she also didn't listen when I asked for water without ice. Eek!

3TMJr0knOhbR26N-9ELZBw.text: Service: Great. The staff is very nice.  The food is okay but could be better. I ordered the sashimi plate. The pieces were large but it was still slightly frozen.  I'm not sure how well it is known but the majority of sushi places actually freeze their fish. Theirs hadn't fully thawed out.   Ultimately, I'm on the fence, it would be a three but when you're in an airport you're options are limited.

gpBMiMrH4Hd9QsfoPWPl6w.text: Many times I have passed this fairly new outpost at CLT, but I had 20 minutes to snack and found a spot at the bar for a quick bite and drink. I had the CLT roll, and a glass of Kim Crawford wine. Aimee my server had it on my plate in no time. Despite the all disposable glass and plate ware I was very impressed. Back next week, do they do sushi for breakfast?

2RjkjfIJ9bHi5fAZVpFHeg.text: Poor service, and stale fish. I had Yellowfin Nigiri, and I've never seen Yellowfin that color or with a fishy smell. I deserve whatever happens next, but perhaps you can be more wise than I and listen to that little voice in your head that says "you're seriously going to eat sushi in an airport in North Carolina before getting on an airplane for three hours?!?"

qQ-YC0mriS7bpUyH38vo6A.text: If you are between flights, and want to get a quick bite without resorting to fast food, this is a good choice. They will make you anything on the menu, and they also have a refrigerated case with premade items. The sushi I had was ok, nothing to get excited about, about on par with what I could get at my grocery store. However, as an alternative to a Big Mac and fries for someone who is trying to make healthier choices, this fit the bill.

2I2T1HalRq9vZAOgk7ER8g.text: I saw the to-go bento box option with a couple rolls, done sashimi and salad for $14 dollars as I passed by. It looked good so I thought that dining there would have better food and cheap options.  Not True. What can I expect though, I'm at an airport. I should've gone to an actually restaurant rather than sushi.   I ended up getting the CLT Roll. It was okay. It is spicy but that's expected from a roll with jalapenos there was a lot of sauce on it m could've masked the flavor of the sushi. What I didn't like was my yellowtail nigiri. I get yellow tail wherever I go and this was no good.  It was thickly sliced, and I don't know why, but part of it was chewy. So chewy, that I couldn't tear it with my teeth and I ended up not eating that piece. Total, my bill was $19. I should've stuck with the bento box. It would've been more filling and the better price point.

F6Ordv_WmsQq_kDcsZx6uw.text: Stopped here after I couldn't decide what to eat before my flight out.  I had never really noticed there was a sushi option at Charlotte Douglas, but I was sort of excited instead of having to eat any of the fast food fare.  I ordered a tall beer, edamame, and 2 sushi rolls.  The server was friendly enough and there was a pretty busy Friday crowd going.  I think the best thing that this place had going for it was it's location:  around the flying mobile of various flying machines in the center of the terminal and also next to the grand piano (that someone was playing that night).  The lady was playing up-tempo contemporary pop songs on the piano and was quite good.  It was nice to listen and realize you are listening to Lady Gaga on the piano while having sushi.  The beer was excellent, unfortunately that was the high point of the meal.  The edamame seemed re-heated... not really freshly steamed... and the sushi rolls had a "not-so-fresh" feel to them.  I'm sure they rolled them after I ordered, but the ingredients may not have been the best.  I did manage to eat everything... but was left wanting since my bill came up to close to $40 bucks (for one person!).  Now I know eating sushi can get pretty pricey, but I think the concept of sushi + airport location made for a runaway pricing situation......  not to mention $10 for a beer!

az14NpAPSEbchF4yvQ53dg.text: Service was quick and efficient, but the sushi was subpar. I ordered the CLT roll and the combination of salmon and tuna reads well, but the addition of srirachi sauce over powers the dish. I would adjust the roll and take out the hot sauce. Overall, the good service compensated for the pricey roll, which equated for the 3/5 rating.

RTNJ5XwMYCWCR_2vnwqnkQ.text: Had better sushi but for airport food you can't complain. Well-priced combos available, and plenty of beers, many on draught. Service was great and attentive, and the atmosphere was the icing on the cake. Music playing and drink in hand best spot on D terminal to chill pre-flight.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

GX6tjld8Yt-0e73T1Mdr4w.text: I have passed this place oh so many times & it was only recently that I finally had enough time to actually sit at CLT Airport to grab a bite....This was definitely the place. The sushi was just so delicious. Very fresh, large, and full of flavor. Great menu selection. I selected the price section as "spendy" because I am adding on an appetizer & optional beverage.  Nothing like a hot saki, cold beer, and yummy sushi to enjoy before getting on a packed plane.

F1oRt8t1Diwhuue0UeKCRA.text: Great atmosphere, good service. The salmon salad is amazing, good combination ingredients. Good option for airport meals

ZkfV-QCsNgtgsjNTNvVUgg.text: Actually pretty good sushi for airport food that is.  I guess that my standards or expectations are lower given that it's in North Carolina and in the airport and we're talking sushi not barbeque.  The CLT was spicy, very hot, which is the way I like it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

PVpoCCmSv1mwyuPaWMfs4A.text: I had a layover at the Charlotte Airport and a little time before I had to catch my next flight.  I looked at the choices in their food court and chose sushi.   The setup for this place is basically a kiosk.   They have prepackaged sushi and what they call a "dine in" menu for fresh sushi but you can't dine in because it's not a restaurant.   It's a kiosk (which seems haphazardly placed in whatever open spot could be found in the middle section of the food court).  There are bar stools placed around the kiosk for the so called "dine in" experience.  There was barely enough elbow room between the stools.  If you add to that the fact that most people would have luggage because it's located at the airport, then you are talking even less comfortable space for dining.    So...for that reason, I decided to get a prepackaged tray of california rolls, because how could you mess up a basic california roll. There were nine rolls in my tray.  it was reasonably priced and it tastes pretty much like any other tray of california rolls.  It was enough to feel me up before my next flight.  So, I was satisfied.  That's it...it was just enough, nothing special.  So for that reason, it gets 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyoza(pot stickers) and Southern charm roll (8 pieces)

4TEZeNyFQdw8Zr5ODBl1IQ.text: Ok, if this place was in Downtown Charlotte my review would be different.  It's in an airport folks so I go in with low expectations.  Let's face it most airport food, is overpriced and crappy.  First in Flight was actually pretty good.  For what you get it is reasonably priced and probably the best value at Clt Douglas airprt.  Service was quick and the sushi was fresh and flavorful.  The rolls were pretty typical.  It's right in the center of the main terminal so there's plenty of scenery for you to enjoy while you're eating.  I fly out of CLT pretty often and will definitely come back here vs. venturing down a concourse for something else.

0AvpMk6a6LB6Yp24zx4TDg.text: Rice is soggy and has no shape.  Bloody Mary is weak and not spicy. Go eat the bbq instead

fB8jyd2s7gfDq8Wxmt_VdQ.text: Wasn't sure about airport sushi but fresh and tasty!  Enjoyed the fish and chips (spicy tuna and spicy salmon in multi grain chips) simple yet creative name :) and it was fresh.   Southern charm was also tasty and adeptly named.  Nice combination without feeling it like it was trying to hard.    Janice the server gets two thumbs up from me!

V42pvCcpikc3G-lI27V4rA.text: I stopped here before my flight back home. I noticed there was a sushi option instead of the usual fast food and decided to go with the sushi - BIG MISTAKE! I should have had Burger King and maybe I wouldn't have had an hour and a half of stomach pains all the way from Charlotte to Newark! Don't get me wrong, the service was friendly and attentive. The waitress constantly checked up to see how things were going. But that's not enough for me to come back to this place. The sushi was absolutely HORRENDOUS!  I ordered the edamame and the grand finale specialty roll (Shrimp Tempura, Avocado & Cucumber Topped With Spicy Crab Scallions, Red & Black Tobiko).  The edamame was OK, but not the best I've had. The sushi was horrible! Way too much rice around the roll (felt like rubber while chewing). The shrimp tempura itself was disgusting. It honestly tasted like cardboard. Despite the massive amount of soy sauce and wasabi I put on the rolls, the sushi still didn't taste like anything except for cardboard! That's when you know you have some stale sushi my friends!   Please avoid at all costs! I know sushi is the healthier option, but if it's going to make me sick on my flight back home, I'd rather stick to fast food!

9x4FZdMzCk4DagKQTlyG7w.text: Overpriced and mediocre quality sushi. They crank the rolls out very fast so that's good...but also bad because they're not put together too well.

uKKuNgm2DPv3MI6kC6Dfhw.text: You must think... I must not know anything about sushi to think this place has 5 star sushi quality. But before you judge me, let me share my reasoning. Guys, I'm at an airport, in Charlotte NC and I am sure not looking for the best meal of my life. I just want to not feel hungry, not break the bank and just. go. home! I'm tired of eating greasy and fried food at the airport and also tired of sitting at a food court with dirty chairs and tables. When I saw Hissho Sushi, my heart soared.  They have a twist to traditional rolls. i.e. they added a tangy, spicy mango sauce over the typical rainbow roll (tuna, white fish and salmon on california rolls). I always dip my sushi in the little plate of soy sauce and wasabi, but here, my cute sushi rolls are taking a quick dive in this special sauce. I must say, it is quite different but it tastes so refreshing and good!  The best part is, I feel GREAT after eating there. It doesn't make me feel disgusted like after eating a burger or a plate of fries. It was uplifting and gave me hope that should anything go wrong at the airport, they will be there to comfort me with a fresh plate of sushi.   Service is awesome. They have 2 hostess and each of them serves 50% of the tables. I wasn't sure how it works but if you see a table, grab it! The hostess will then come to you and take your order. There is no line but a first come first serve basis. The hostess checked on me every so often and made sure my water glass was full. Also, they have the prettiest disposable plates ever! I know, I'm OCD. Although they are disposable plastic plates, they look super elegant and clean in white. They made my dish look extra posh. How awesome was that?!   This is definitely my place to go to when I'm in, through or stuck in CLT. Great job guys!

0TimvDCZ6GqHTmbrfeCoQg.text: Another trip...and more sushi that well......is not even as good as the stuff you buy at a grocery store.........I mean a "not that nice of a grocery store".  I think I need to have them make it for me, vs. buying it to take on the plane as the to go stuff never seems fresh.

ia8KVXPCYDlMIUMXFUtV4Q.text: No need to look at menu, get the Take-off roll, it is awesome!  Centrally located at Charlotte airport, this bar is also a sushi bar and is very quick and very good!

BsK6GGbqZCtW7jw2FKJBOg.text: It's easy to miss this newly opened Sushi place inside the airport in the same location as the First In Flight Bar.  Stopped in for dinner on my way back to DC from Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi at CLT airport

v3fc1UBsJbzX1fHCT38Saw.text: I stumbled upon this restaurant during a layover. The bar seating was nice and there was also some hidden outlets underneath it. I took a moment to look over the menu and decided to stay.   I had the tempura shrimp temaki. It was good, not overly delicious, but good. The temaki is a hand roll. The sushi is rolled almost like a burrito and you just grab it and bite. The thing that made this only good and not great is the shrimp. They use already prepared tempura shrimp, not cool. The tempura isn't crisp and it gives a packaged sushi taste to a fresh roll.   The waiters are very friendly and attentive. Overall, I would eat here again if I have another layover at this airport.

kG3r6DohwzYuid1Xe17Q4g.text: Sushi was out of this world, but the service was awful. Waited 15 minutes to see a waiter, another 25 to get my food (3 people that came after me and had different servers got their orders first), and another 20 to get my check (which I ended up having to ask the hostess for since the waiter was MIA). Once again, the sushi was great - fresh and numerous options. I strongly suggest you get it to go and eat at your gate.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

yKuowD5iUUQZ8Td64Jis8g.text: My first time at this restaurant was during my observation flight in ground school. My classmate and I were hungry and the rest of the group went out for Salsarita and we chose this place since sushi is my favorite food. The service was impeccable and the workstation in the portions were plentiful and fresh. Every time I walk through the airport I see happy customers and I cannot wait to sit down and have the ahi tunain the beautiful martini glass on top of the bed seaweed salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Hissho Sushi At First In Flight Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great service. Airline employee discount.

JhMy6AKE-KhyuFItmamypQ.text: When you travel a lot, sometimes consistency is a great thing.  Is it the best sushi you'll ever have? No. Is it possible to use the words "airport" and "sushi" in the same sentence without looking like a twit? Absolutely. To digress, the best airport sushi I've ever had is at Detroit Metro, followed closely by the one at Reagan.   This place isn't perfect by any stretch. Just about any non-fish item is nuked-while-you-wait (like soup or edamame) and served on plastic. However, the fish isn't bad. Stick with the rolls. They're all fairly good and, from a frequent traveler's standpoint, consistent visit after visit.   I've been eating here for several years now, and it's definitely one of the healthier options at CLT.

BeThURZ-O03httBS10t7vQ.text: It is what it is.  The sushi isn't amazing, but its still probably one of the best deals on food in Charlotte Airport.  That doesn't make it a good deal, just one considering where your at.  I figured it up and there was a bento box that saved you a couple bucks over buying the items seperately.  The seaweed salad and spicy tuna was good, the fish was fresh, and the chefs were really quick with it.  All this said, if I paid this much for mediocre sushi at a regular restaurant, this would be a 1-2 star review.

GpFpqPNTRRm3Ie__VmW81A.text: One of my favorite things about flying into Charlotte is the First in Flight Bar. During the hustle and bustle of traveling, it's always a nice feeling when I have a little extra time during a layover in the Queen City so I can relax for a few moments here.  Sushi in Charlotte. This may not be the first type of food that you think about when you are in the Carolinas, but it's here...and there is a lot of great sushi here. I wouldn't put Hissho up in the "great" category, but it's decent, and coupled with its "great" location...it's one of my regular stops across the country.   All of the sushi that I've gotten here has been fresh. The specialty rolls are a little heavy, but good. They do have a lot of options with cream cheese or spicy sriracha. I haven't tried any of their sashimi...I just don't think that this is the spot for it.   I definitely recommend the next time you fly into Charlotte, and have a little extra time during your layover, give it a go. Relax, sit at a table, have a drink and roll or two, and people watch until your departure time arrives. It's the perfect time waster.

rKaJfEk2DIl61QEMPIXC2A.text: I've been back here and the sushi is still the same. Don't try anything crazy. Just stick to the basics and you'll get by just fine. Asked for water and lemon. Just the water showed up. The piano next to the place can make it annoying. Avoid the sushi.

s1q4hZTflBU9ajOspV58PQ.text: This is a sushi joint in an airport, so you have to drop your expectations just a little bit. Now normally I am fine with low expectations, but the prices here are what you'd expect to pay for pretty decent sushi - not frozen fish. No disrespect to the chef, since the menu was fun and the rolls were creative, but charging $15 for a roll made with frozen tuna isn't gonna earn you a high review.  Expect grocery-store sushi taste.  This is a great place for people watching, which almost earns it 3 stars.  But not quite.
